intro: Anthemis segetalis, commonly known as the field chamomile, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces a strong, aromatic scent due to the presence of essential oils. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and have a distinctive serrated edge. Anthemis segetalis is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
